abstract: Japan, in stunning upset, defeats South Africa in first round of Rugby World Cup; other first round results noted.
lead_paragraph: Japan scored a huge Rugby World Cup upset as the substitute Karne Hesketh scored a thrilling last-minute try to beat two-time champion South Africa, 34-32, in their opening Pool B match in Brighton, England.
snippet: Japan scored a huge Rugby World Cup upset as the substitute Karne Hesketh scored a thrilling last-minute try to beat two-time champion South Africa, 34-32, in their opening Pool B match in Brighton, England.
